executiveSummary: Jonathan from Minnesota pitched 'Snow in Seconds,' an artificial snow product, seeking $50,000 for 10% equity. Despite skepticism from most Sharks about its seasonality and lack of proprietary technology, Barbara Corcoran offered $50,000 for 33% equity, which Jonathan accepted.
keyDecisions: Barbara Corcoran invested $50,000 for 33% equity in Snow in Seconds.

actionItems.task: Collaborate with Barbara Corcoran to expand Snow in Seconds retail presence and leverage her experience with seasonal consumer products.
Barbara to introduce Jonathan to retail accounts opened through her existing holiday businesses like Hollyball.

nextSteps: Jonathan and Barbara will work together to scale Snow in Seconds through Barbaraâ€™s retail and marketing channels, aiming to bring the product to stores nationwide.
